title: Dramatic rescue of 300 from migrant boat in Italy
description: Some people were already in the water when the Italian coastguard reached them off Lampedusa Island.

title: Egypt: Grand opening for Luxor's 'Avenue of the Sphinxes'
description: The ancient walkway, connecting two of the Egyptian city's greatest temples, took decades to excavate.

title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer: Marcus Rashford says sacked Manchester United boss 'deserves huge respect'
description: Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford says the club's players still respect former boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, who was sacked from his job at Old Trafford last weekend.

title: Quiz of the week: Why did Boris Johnson like Peppa Pig World so much?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Channel tragedy: Scramble to identify dead off Calais
description: At least 27 people died trying to reach the UK by boat. Officials are trying to find their identities.

title: Channel deaths: More boats arrive after 27 people drown
description: Three children and a pregnant woman were among 27 who drowned trying to get to the UK on Wednesday.

title: Passports: Delivery firm apologises for UK delays
description: TNT-owner FedEx is sorry as hundreds say they have faced long waits to receive travel documents.

title: Asylum claims to UK reach highest level in nearly 20 years
description: Separate figures show net migration to the UK fell 88% last year due to Covid restrictions.

title: Channel deaths: What do we know so far?
description: There are many unanswered questions following the deaths of 27 people. Here is what we know so far.

title: Jersey approves principle of legalising assisted dying
description: The agreement in principle means further debates on rules and safeguards will take place in Jersey.

title: Jennifer and Stephen Chapple: Man appears in court over murders
description: Collin Reeves is accused of killing Jennifer and Stephen Chapple while their children were sleeping.

title: The Star Inn at Harome: Michelin-starred restaurant 'reduced to ashes'
description: Chef Andrew Pern's Star Inn in North Yorkshire is gutted when a blaze engulfs its thatched roof.

title: Arsene Wenger: Mikel Arteta wants ex-Arsenal boss to return to club
description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says he has discussed bringing former Gunners manager Arsene Wenger back to the club.

title: Women's safety: Clubs see rising demand for self-defence classes
description: Increasing numbers of women have been taking up self-defence classes, a number of clubs have told the BBC.

title: Iyer impresses for India on Test debut against New Zealand
description: Debutant Shreyas Iyer hits an unbeaten 75 as India reach 258-4 on day one of the first Test against New Zealand in Kanpur.

title: Richard Madeley: I'm a Celebrity star taken to hospital
description: The TV presenter became ill overnight while on the set of the show and was first seen by medics.

title: London Stratford emerges as UK's busiest station
description: It was the most used during a year of lockdowns that saw passenger numbers drop 78% due to Covid.

title: Jessie J reveals 'shock and overwhelming sadness' of miscarriage
description: The singer says an outpouring of support "is felt, received and appreciated beyond measure".

title: Caroline Glachan: Three arrests over 1996 death of schoolgirl
description: The body of 14-year-old Caroline Glachan was discovered in West Dunbartonshire in August 1996.

title: Roman mosaic and villa complex found in Rutland farmer's field
description: The mosaic, part of a villa complex, is said to be one of the most significant found in Britain.

title: Can an ex-Palace striker and the 'new Zlatan' fire Sociedad to first La Liga title in 40 years?
description: Real Sociedad are being talked about as potential La Liga winners for the first time in 40 years. This is why they are now a force in Spain.

title: Aberfan: Tests on children after disaster 'like torture'
description: Pulled from the rubble, some survivors say they were made to take tests to get compensation.

title: Historic Photographer of the Year Awards 2021 winners revealed
description: Steve Liddiard's picture of the Whiteford Point Lighthouse in the Gower Peninsula was named overall winner.

title: Kavala: The case that set Turkey on collision course with the West
description: Osman Kavala has not been convicted but his detention has set Turkey's leader on a collision course.

title: Peter Jackson on how Tolkien stopped a Beatles LOTR film
description: While making his Beatles series Get Back, the director learned about the Fab Four's letdown.

title: Vagrancy: Government urged to decriminalise rough sleeping
description: A group of peers are urging the government to repeal the Vagrancy Act which makes it a criminal offence to sleep rough or beg in England and Wales.

title: Russian troop build-up: View from Ukraine front line
description: BBC correspondent Abdujalil Abdurasulov visits eastern Ukraine as soldiers watch Russia's nearby movements.

title: Man City 2-1 Paris St-Germain: Mauricio Pochettino left envious as Pep Guardiola thrives
description: Manchester City outplayed Paris St-Germain and with Mauricio Pochettino struggling to impose his style the Manchester United talk will not go away, writes Phil McNulty.

title: Why this city is Europe's best kept cycling secret
description: Portugal's bike factories have been very busy since April 2020 as cycling has surged in popularity.
